meanings.definition: A small, overhanging turret at the corner of a castle or tower.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had bartizans that overlooked the surrounding lands.
meanings.sent2: The architect included bartizans in the design of the tower for both protection and aesthetics.
meanings.sent3: The birds found a cozy spot to build their nest on the bartizans of the castle.
meanings.sent4: The bartizans of the tower stood like watchful guardians, keeping a silent vigil over the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The bartizans jutted out from the castle walls like tiny balconies for the knights to stand upon.

meanings.definition: A projecting structure on a building, typically at a corner, used for defense or decoration.
meanings.sent1: The old fortress had bartizans that provided a strategic advantage during battles.
meanings.sent2: The ornate bartizans added a touch of elegance to the otherwise plain building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the bartizans were secret hideouts from imaginary enemies.
meanings.sent4: The bartizans of the building cast long shadows in the evening sun, creating a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent5: The bartizans were like architectural jewels adorning the corners of the structure.
